glosses: big, large, great (of a great size)
grand (standing in the second or more remote degree of parentage)

categories: Finnish entries with incorrect language header

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

examples.translation: to cram (information) into one's head, to study hard
examples.english: to cram (information) into one's head, to study hard

glosses: head (leader, expert, e.g. of an organisation)
end, tip (physical end, especially when there is no clear "beginning" and "end" but only two ends, and especially one that tapers to a single point)

raw_glosses: (in external locative cases, in expressions) mood

categories: Finnish entries with incorrect language header
etymology_text: From Proto-Finnic *pää, from Proto-Finno-Ugric *päŋe. Cognates include Estonian pea, Veps pä, Moksha and Erzya пе (pe, “end”) and Hungarian fej, fő.
